thread.title: What Slump? Some Manhattan Retailers Look to Own Buildings Instead of Renting Them

author: Keiko Morris
title: What Slump? Some Manhattan Retailers Look to Own Buildings Instead of Renting Them
text:
Small businesses largely steered clear of real-estate investments during the heady days of soaring rents and prices for Manhattan retail properties. Now that prices are coming down, some are exploring the possibility of owning their space.
Earlier this year, a venture led by chef Stefano Secchi and entrepreneur David Switzer bought a four-story building with a vacant restaurant space in the Flatiron District, paying less than the asking price. The two are planning to open a restaurant there, with housing above it.
